name: NPR
text:
RT @WorldCafe: The two country-leaning singer-songwriters on their time in Nashville, addressing the darkness of life while staying in the light and the difficulties of thinking forward in the South. @beccamancari
@SGGoodmanKY https://t.co/exp9y836AJ

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Deborah Birx says the CDC is working on a new way to track COVID-19 hospitalizations ‚Äî just a month after the Trump administration mandated that hospitals sidestep the CDC in collecting such data.
https://t.co/WTVjeaX8P8

name: NPR
text:
It's the final night of the #DemConvention. 

Joe Biden is set to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for president and will take center stage to lay out his vision for America.

Join us for live video and analysis.
https://t.co/yKej0YASKl

name: NPR
text:
Andrew Yang: ‚ÄúI have gotten to know both Joe and Kamala on the trail over the past year ... They understand the problems we face. They are parents and patriots who want the best for our country." #DemConvention
https://t.co/xRDbSf96ql

name: NPR
text:
Introducing a tribute to the late civil rights icon John Lewis, Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms says: ‚ÄúThe baton has now been passed to each of us.‚Äù 

‚ÄúWe must register, and we must vote.‚Äù #DemConvention https://t.co/oHT13Lr7mo

name: NPR
text:
Democrats once again honored Rep. John Lewis, the late civil rights icon, who died last month. ‚ÄúFrom day one, John Lewis was a role model in the Congress,‚Äù said House Speaker Nancy Pelosi in a tribute video. #DemConvention
https://t.co/0VbnxzI7Y4

name: NPR
text:
Julia Louis-Dreyfus quipped that she can‚Äôt wait to see the vice presidential debate featuring Kamala Harris and ‚ÄúMica Pints ‚Ä¶ or is it Paints?‚Äù she said at the DNC, taking aim at Republicans who can't seem to pronounce Kamala Harris' name correctly.
https://t.co/QZbac55Y2R

name: NPR
text:
Rep. Deb Haaland is a 35th generation New Mexican and one of the first Native Americans elected to Congress.

‚ÄúWhether we vote and how we vote will determine if our nation‚Äôs promise of social, racial and environmental justice will outlast us," she says.
https://t.co/h2sjMF9Dvh

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Cory Booker: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the American Dream: Together we work, together we rise."

"[President Trump] has failed us. But still, I believe in the dream of our ancestors.‚Äù #DemConvention https://t.co/yHdFIzNWOl

name: NPR
text:
A 95-year-old WWII veteran, Ed Good, who voted for Trump in 2016, expressed his support for Joe Biden at the #DemConvention.

‚ÄúI think Trump has been the worst president we‚Äôve ever had. So I‚Äôll be glad to see him go,‚Äù he said.
https://t.co/ZsjFQjUHPM

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tammy Baldwin: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs another part of my story.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe part where I worked with Joe Biden and Barack Obama to make sure kids ‚Ä¶ can stay on their parents‚Äô health insurance until they are 26. We got that done. And, yes, it was a big effing deal.‚Äù https://t.co/ePWfh4N3YB

name: NPR
text:
Democrats paid tribute tonight to Joe Biden‚Äôs late son, Beau, who died of cancer in 2015.

‚ÄúHe really was the best of us," Kamala Harris said recently. "And when I would ask him, ‚ÄòWhere‚Äôd this come from?‚Äô he‚Äôd always talk about his dad.‚Äù #DemConvention 
https://t.co/IlEd0T8KTa

name: NPR
text:
Pete Buttigieg: ‚ÄúI joined a military where firing me because of who I am wasn‚Äôt just possible ‚Äî it was policy."

Now "it is unlawful in America to fire someone because of who they are. ‚Ä¶ The very ring on my finger ‚Ä¶ reflects how this country can change.‚Äù https://t.co/LcQcBH2xs0

name: NPR
text:
A Trump campaign spokesman wrote off the far-right, wholly unsubstantiated QAnon conspiracy theory, telling NPR that he and President Trump rarely discussed it other than to say it was "junk."

Trump offered praise for the conspiracy's followers Wednesday.
https://t.co/h4lRv7RSYh

name: NPR
text:
Brayden Harrington, a 13-year-old with a stutter, recalled the time Joe Biden told him about his own experience growing up with a stutter.

‚ÄúWithout Joe Biden, I wouldn‚Äôt be talking to you today,‚Äù Harrington said.
https://t.co/zYMeHkAlYE

name: NPR
text:

We're annotating his remarks live with analysis and fact checks.
